title: Alex Bowman Exits NASCAR Race Due to Illness
summary: Alex Bowman withdrew from the NASCAR race at COTA due to illness. Myatt Snyder replaced him in the No. 48 Chevrolet.
charlotte_impact: Highlights the unpredictable nature of sports and the importance of backup plans for teams and athletes.

title: Carolinas Leaders React to Trump's Iran Attack
summary: Politicians in the Carolinas offer varied responses to President Trump's attack on Iran, reflecting national divisions.
charlotte_impact: Shows the local impact of national and international events and the diverse political opinions within the region.

title: Charlotte Airport Increases Parking Rates
summary: Charlotte Douglas Airport raises parking rates across all lots and decks, with funds earmarked for facility improvements.
charlotte_impact: Impacts travelers using the airport and highlights ongoing efforts to improve airport infrastructure and services.

title: AI Advances Maternal Health Equity: Neshé Conley Spotlight
summary: WCNC Charlotte features Neshé Conley, who uses AI to address maternal health disparities, for Women's History Month.
charlotte_impact: Showcases innovative solutions to healthcare challenges and celebrates women's contributions to the community.

title: Warmer Weather Arrives for Meteorological Spring
summary: The first day of meteorological spring brings warmer temperatures, with sunshine and highs in the 70s expected.
charlotte_impact: Provides a weather update relevant to daily life and outdoor activities in the Charlotte area.

title: NC Lawmakers Divided on US-Israel Strikes on Iran
summary: North Carolina lawmakers split along party lines regarding the US-Israel 'Operation Epic Fury' strikes on Iran.
charlotte_impact: Reflects the national debate on foreign policy and the differing viewpoints within the state's legislature.

title: Sinkhole Swallows Pickup Truck in Gastonia
summary: A sinkhole in Gastonia swallowed an unattended pickup truck overnight. No injuries were reported.
charlotte_impact: Highlights infrastructure challenges and potential hazards in the area, raising awareness for drivers.

title: Charlotte Protests Against Iran Strikes
summary: Protesters in Charlotte rally against the U.S.-Israeli military strikes on Iran at Romare Bearden Park.
charlotte_impact: Demonstrates local engagement with international issues and the right to protest in a democratic society.

title: Huntersville Plans to Address Congested Corridor
summary: Huntersville is developing plans to alleviate traffic congestion on NC-115, a major thoroughfare.
charlotte_impact: Addresses a common concern for residents and commuters and signals potential infrastructure improvements.

title: Early Voting Ends for NC Primary Elections
summary: North Carolina residents have until 3 p.m. Saturday to cast their ballots early in the pivotal primary elections.
charlotte_impact: Encourages civic engagement and informs voters about the timeline for participating in the electoral process.

title: Overnight Shooting in East Charlotte Injures One
summary: A shooting in the 6500 block of E W.T. Harris Boulevard in east Charlotte leaves one person critically injured.
charlotte_impact: Raises concerns about public safety and highlights the ongoing issue of gun violence in the city.

title: I-485 Express Lanes Open in Charlotte
summary: The I-485 Express Lanes in south Charlotte are now open, offering a faster route between I-77 and U.S. 74.
charlotte_impact: Provides commuters with a new option for navigating traffic and potentially reducing travel times.

title: Woman Dies After Assault in East Charlotte
summary: A woman dies weeks after being assaulted in east Charlotte. A suspect is in custody as of Feb. 27, 2026.
charlotte_impact: Highlights the severity of violent crime and the importance of holding perpetrators accountable.

title: Mother and Boyfriend Accused of Assaulting 1-Year-Old
summary: A mother and her boyfriend are accused of assaulting a 1-year-old in Burke County, causing a fractured arm.
charlotte_impact: Addresses a serious case of child abuse and the legal consequences for those responsible.

title: CMPD Targets South Charlotte Crime Hotspots
summary: CMPD implements 'Queen City Safe' patrols in South Charlotte to address crime hotspots, expanding the safety initiative.
charlotte_impact: Demonstrates law enforcement's efforts to reduce crime and improve public safety in specific areas.
